segment.documentation: BGM, A segment by which the sender must uniquely identify the Announcement For Returns message.
DTM, A segment specifying the dates, and when relevant, the times related to the whole message. The segment must be specified at least once to specify the message date as allocated by the sender.

FTX, A segment with free text information, in coded or clear form, used when additional information is needed but cannot be accommodated within other segments. In computer to computer exchanges such text will normally require the receiver to process this segment manually.
CUX, A segment to specify currencies and relevant details for the rate of exchange.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 1: A group of segments identifying documents which the message sender requests to receive, and if necessary when he wishes to receive them, as a result of the announcement of returns message, e.g. returns instruction, credit note.

segment.documentation: DOC, A segment by which the sender of the message indicates to the receiver what type of document or message is required in return (e.g. returns instruction, credit note).
DTM, A segment specifying the date and where necessary the time related to the current document. This segment may be used to indicate required document receipt dates, times, or periods.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 2: A group of segments providing references and where necessary associated dates related to the current message, e.g. despatch note number, invoice, etc.

segment.documentation: RFF, A segment for identifying a reference by its type and number.
DTM, A segment specifying the date and where necessary the time of the reference.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 3: A group of segments identifying the parties involved in the announcement for returns message and any associated information.

segment.documentation: NAD, A segment to identify a party name and address, either by coded identification or in clear form. It is recommended that where possible only the coded form of the party identification should be specified, e.g. the Buyer and Seller are known to each other, thus only the coded identification is required. It is recommended that the party announcing the return and the party to whom the announcement is directed are identified in this segment.
LOC, A segment to allow the further identification of locations related to the current party, e.g. the location of the goods for return.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 4: A group of segments for specifying any references related to the current.

segment.documentation: RFF, A segment for identifying a reference related to the current party by its type and number.
DTM, A segment specifying the date and where necessary the time of the reference.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 5: A group of segments identifying the contact person or department for the current party.

segment.documentation: CTA, A segment to identify a person or department and their function, to whom communications should be directed.
COM, A segment specifying the communication channel and number for the specified contact.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 6: A group of segments indicating the terms of delivery for the whole announcement for returns.

segment.documentation: TOD, A segment identifying the delivery terms used, e.g. INCOTERMS code could be used to specify the delivery terms.
LOC, A segment identifying locations relevant to the delivery terms.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 7: A group of segments identifying the mode and means of transport, location and relevant dates and times for transportation, relating to the whole announcement for returns.

segment.documentation: TDT, A segment specifying the mode and means of the transport for the goods being announced for return.
LOC, A segment identifying locations relevant to the transport details.
DTM, A segment identifying any dates associated with the transport details.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 8: A group of segments to specify equipment necessary for transport.

segment.documentation: EQD, A segment to specify equipment, equipment size and type used in the transport.
MEA, A segment to specify measurements associated with the equipment, such as weight.
FTX, A segment to specify processable supplementary information associated with the equipment.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 9: A group of segments specifying allowances and, or charges for the whole announcement for returns message. Information specified in this segment group may be used to identify charges which will be imposed or allowances which will be requested by the message sender to cover the cost of storing the goods for return. Additional information, dates and times, monetary amounts and tax details which are related to the allowances or charges may also be specified.

segment.documentation: ALC, A segment identifying the charge or allowance and where necessary its calculation sequence.
ALI, A segment indicating that allowance or charge specified is subject to special conditions owing to origin, customs preference or commercial factors.
DTM, A segment specifying any dates and, or times which are related to the allowances or charges.
MOA, A segment to specify any monetary amounts related to the current allowances or charges.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 10: A group of segments specifying tax related information for the allowances or charges.

segment.documentation: TAX, A segment specifying the tax type, category and rate, or exemption, related to the allowances or charges.
MOA, A segment specifying amounts related to the tax details for the allowance or charge. 4.1.2 Detail section Information to be provided in the Detail section:

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 11: SG13-SG14-SG15-SG16-SG17-SG18-SG20-SG21-SG22 A group of segments providing details of the individual items which are being announced for return. There must be at least one occurrence of this segment group within an announcement for returns.

segment.documentation: LIN, A segment identifying a line item by the line item number and configuration level, and additionally, identifying the return product. Other product identification numbers, e.g. supplier product number etc., can be specified within the following PIA segment.
PIA, A segment to provide additional identification to the product specified in the LIN segment (e.g. Harmonized System number).
IMD, A segment for describing the current line item as well as product characteristic. This segment should be used for products that cannot be fully identified by an article number.
MEA, A segment enabling the physical measurements of the current item to be specified where this is required for full identification of the product.
DTM, A segment specifying date and or time, or period details relating to the current line item only, e.g. receipt date, requested pick-up date.
PRI, A segment to provide the details of the price of the product which is being announced for return.

FTX, A segment with free text information, in coded or clear form, used when additional information is needed but cannot be accommodated within other segments. In computer to computer exchanges such text will normally require the receiver to process this segment manually.
LOC, A segment to allow the further identification of locations related to the current line item, e.g. location of product for return.
MOA, A segment specifying any monetary amounts relating to the product, e.g. credit note amount.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 12: A group of segments specifying tax related information for the currently identified product, e.g. tax amount, etc.

segment.documentation: TAX, A segment specifying the tax type, category and rate, or exemption, for the current product.
MOA, A segment specifying amounts related to the tax details for the current product.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 13: A group of segments specifying quantities for return and states related to the quantities being returned, e.g. never ordered, damaged.

segment.documentation: QTY, A segment identifying the product quantities, e.g. requested return quantity.
CDI, A segment to indicate the physical or logical state of the quantity detailed in the QTY segment for the current line item, e.g. never ordered, damaged.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 14: A group of segments identifying documents which the message sender requests to receive, and if necessary when he wishes to receive them, for the current line item only as a result of the announcement of returns message, e.g. returns instruction, credit note.

segment.documentation: DOC, A segment by which the sender of the message indicates to the receiver what type of document or message is required in return (e.g. returns instruction, credit note).
DTM, A segment specifying the date and where necessary the time related to the current document.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 15: A group of segments for specifying any references relating to the current line item only, e.g. invoice number, etc.

segment.documentation: RFF, A segment for the inclusion of any references related to the current line item.
DTM, A segment specifying the date and where necessary the time of the reference.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 16: A group of segments giving information about dangerous goods.

segment.documentation: DGS, A segment to indicate the class of dangerous goods.
QTY, A segment to specify quantity of the given dangerous goods.
FTX, A segment to describe dangerous goods.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 17: A group of segments identifying handling instructions relevant to the current line item only.

segment.documentation: HAN, A segment providing information on required handling and notification of hazardous materials relevant to the current line item only.

FTX, A segment with free text information relevant to the handling instructions, in coded or clear form, used when additional handling information is needed. In computer to computer exchanges such text will normally require the receiver to process this segment manually.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 18: A group of segments identifying packaging, marks and numbers, date and time information for the product which is announced for return.

segment.documentation: PAC, A segment specifying the number and type of the packages and, or physical units and the type of packaging for the current line item.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 19: A group of segments specifying markings, labels, and packing numbers for the current package.

segment.documentation: PCI, A segment specifying markings and or labels used on the current package.
DTM, A segment for specifying date and or time, or period related to the package.
GIN, A segment providing the identity numbers of the current package.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 20: A group of segments identifying the mode and means of transport, location and relevant dates and times for transportation, relating to the current line item.

segment.documentation: TDT, A segment specifying the mode and means of the transport for the current line item.
LOC, A segment identifying locations relevant to the transport details.
DTM, A segment identifying any dates associated with the transport details.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 21: A group of segments to specify equipment related to the transport of the current line item.

segment.documentation: EQD, A segment to specify equipment, equipment size and type used in the transport.
MEA, A segment to specify measurements, other than dimensions, associated with the equipment, such as weight.
FTX, A segment to specify processable supplementary information associated with the equipment.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 22: A group of segments specifying allowances and or charges for the current line item only. Information specified in this segment group may be used to identify charges which will be imposed or allowances which will be requested by the message sender to cover the cost of storing the goods for return. Additional information, dates and times, monetary amounts and tax details which are related to the allowances or charges may also be specified.

segment.documentation: ALC, A segment identifying the charge or allowance and where necessary its calculation sequence.
ALI, A segment indicating that allowance or charge specified is subject to special conditions owing to origin, customs preference or commercial factors.
DTM, A segment specifying any dates and, or times which are related to the allowances or charges.
MOA, A segment to specify any monetary amounts related to the current allowances or charges.
PCD, A segment to specify any percentage values related to the current allowances or charges.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 23: A group of segments specifying tax related information for the allowances or charges.

segment.documentation: TAX, A segment specifying the tax type, category and rate, or exemption, related to the allowances or charges.
MOA, A segment specifying amounts related to the tax details for the allowance or charge. 4.1.3 Summary section Information to be provided in the Summary section:
UNS, A segment placed at the start of the summary section to separate the detail and summary sections.
CNT, A segment by which control totals may be provided by the sender for checking by the receiver.
MOA, A segment to specify total monetary amounts for the complete message, e.g. credit note amount.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 24: A group of segments specifying tax totals for the announcement for returns message.

segment.documentation: TAX, A segment specifying the tax type to be summarized.
MOA, A segment specifying the summary amount for the tax specified.
